title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Waterford.org (Houston, TX) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: From start to finish, the interview process was second to none. The journey was rigorous with interviews. However, each interview was very intentional, informative and intriguing to learn more about the organization. Special kudos to Myranda for her consistent communication and follow through during the process making it a smooth overall experience. I’m excited for the opportunity to become a part of the Waterford family! I look forward to the journey!
Interview Questions: Paraphrase: In this period of your life, how does Waterford’s mission and goals align with you?

title: Sr. Director of Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Waterford.org (Memphis, TN) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: I will be joining the Waterford team later this month and wanted to take a moment to compliment, specifically, the Director of Talent Acquistion & Development. From start to finish, she was a consummate professional. She consistently ensured that all my questions were answered regarding next steps, along with any other questions that I had. It is obvious that she cares about the 'applicant experience' and engages accordingly. Whether I received a job offer or not, I can say with confidence that I had a great UX!
Interview Questions: In general, questions were mostly behavior based; requiring you to connect your experience to that of the role you're apply for.

title: UX Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Waterford.org
Interview Descriptions: There were several rounds of interviews, up to 4. A bit lengthy, but they scheduled them quickly and I don't think I spent more than 2 weeks total doing the process.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have designing or working with games?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Waterford.org in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied online in late December 2022, and two days later I got an online assessment, basically two parts, one was creating a data visualization using provided sample viz and data, second was critique a research plan about their new early child education program. In mid January 2023, I had the initial screening interview with recruiter, then had the hiring manager interview 10 days later. The overall experience of interview was weird, I felt the recruiter was working so hard selling this position, but the hiring manager was very strict, inpatient and showing no respect towards a candidate, by throwing questions on me and try to end the interview as soon as possible.
Interview Questions: The hiring manager asked a question related to previous take home research plan critique about how to improve the evaluation approach of their research plan. Also asked a research design related question. Finished the interview by quickly asking about my strength, weakness.

title: Senior Engagement Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Waterford.org in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted virtually with 2 people asking questions. They were super nice but intense. I met first with the talent acquision and she was amazing and made you want to work there.
Interview Questions: describe a time you had to overcome adversity.

title: Coach Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Waterford.org
Interview Descriptions: A few interviews after sending resumes . Not too easy or too hard. HR does pre screening. Questions are standard . Manager interview is ok. If applying for management you’ll have more interviews. DEI is very important.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself abs your previous experience?

title: Program Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Waterford.org (Phoenix, AZ) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Ashley was amazing and so helpful throughout the interview process. My other interviewers were really nice also. I had a screening call with Ashley. Then, I had a interview with two of the program coach team leads.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Waterford? What is your experience with marginalized youth?

title: Director of Employee Benefits Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Waterford.org in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: The review process was smooth and timely. I never felt like I had been waiting for too long before hearing back about the process. I had a total of 3 interviews with different people in the organization, but that I would be working directly with each day.
Interview Questions: In each interview I felt like they were really targeted in the questions to ensure that I would be able to do the job.  A major part of the job is dealing with self-funded health plans, and they asked about my experience with this.

title: Program Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Waterford.org in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my application I was contacted by a recruiter to set up a time to talk to see if I would be a great fit. After talking with the recruiter we were able to set up an interview time for the following week. The interview process went very smoothly. I am normally pretty nervous during interviews but the hiring managers (Also program coach team leads) made me feel very comfortable. They told me they would follow up with me within the next day or so and actually sent scenario questions that same night. After the interview process, the recruiter kept an open line of communication each step of the way when it came to the next steps. Best interview process I've had in a long time!
Interview Questions: How do you feel about having a structured schedule and staying organized?

title: Implementation Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Waterford.org (Allentown, PA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Received a phone call to set up a zoom interview. Follow-up emails of zoom links and necessary paperwork. Then moved to a presentation to the team and then an independent reference survey.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Waterford.org?

title: Senior Implementation Process Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Waterford.org (Midwest City, OK) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: I met with HR to determine if I would be a good fit for the position and make sure that I was interested in continuing through the hiring process based on the information provided. I then met virtually with supervisors who would be responsible for my training and performance outcomes. I was asked to do a presentation on another date after a successful outcome of this interview.
Interview Questions: How do you see your role in working with teachers?

title: Enrollment Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Waterford.org (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: For phase one of an interview there is a phone screening with a recruiter. If they believe you are a good match they will set you up with a interview with that departments leads.
Interview Questions: What is your background in education?

title: Family Education Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Waterford.org (Salt Lake City, UT) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I had the pleasure to talk to Ashley Janke and she was beyond professional.
 She took the time to explain the benefits and what the job offer was all about giving me time to write notes and ask questions.
She was super friendly, and a kindness tone throughout the process.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you felt you helped out a family/ students? And what did you do?

title: Program Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Waterford.org (Charleston, SC) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Ashley contacted me via telephone, we spoke for 40 minutes about the company and asked me questions to gauge qualifications. A few days later I met with two program coaches out of Utah via Zoom.
Interview Questions: I was asked about how I would handle difficult customers and how accustomed I was talking on the phone for extended amounts of time.

title: Director of School Relationships Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Waterford.org in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I met with the head of HR, my potential boss and the VP of School Relationships followed by a presentation which was outlined clearly beforehand. The process was very comfortable, clearly outlined and speaking with everyone was organic.
Interview Questions: There were a number of 'typical' interview questions and they came up by way of our organic conversation.

title: Curriculum Developer Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Waterford.org (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Had 2 good interviews and was asked to give references for the selection. Then I was ghosted. No email if I was chosen or not. Just ghosted. Not professional at all so it was a negative experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Program Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Waterford.org in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions:
1. Phone interview with a recruiter. 
2. Zoom interview with two of the Coach Team Leads.
3. Respond to the email prompts  & complete an Internet Speed Testing
4. Reference Check through email
Interview Questions: Describe a time where I had control over my daily schedule, how did I prioritize my work?

title: Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Waterford.org (West Valley City, UT) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was initially interviewed by a single hiring person, it was easy and fun.  Then I had a second interview with several supervisors, which was informative and relaxed.  During this time I received lots of e-mails and personal support to continue with and complete the hiring process.
Interview Questions: I can't remember exactly.  Mostly questions about my work experience, and how I might act in different scenarios.

title: Program Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Waterford.org (Kansas City, MO) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process began with a phone call from a Waterford recruiter.  If you were chosen to move forward, you received an invitation to a zoom interview with the program supervisors.  You filled out a form for your references and a week later I received a call with an offer.  All staff was super nice, very accommodating and friendly!!
Interview Questions: What is one thing about you that not everyone knows?

title: Partner Success Advocate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Waterford.org (Taylorsville, UT) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: 3-Step Interview Process that consisted of meeting first with the Human Resources recruiter. At the end of that interview she scheduled an interview with the Partner Success Advocate Manager. It was very enjoyable and we covered a variety of subjects related to the position. A short time later they reached out to schedule another interview with the School Relations Director. They were all very genuine people and really interested in my skillset and what I could bring to Waterford.
Interview Questions:
Tell me a little about yourself.
What interests you about this job opening?
What do you know about Waterford?  Early Literacy Skills?
Give me an example of an important goal you have set in the past and about your success in reaching it.
If you were to describe your top three qualities in working with others, what would they be?
Describe the most difficult problem you had to solve last year.
How do you handle people that are very emotional or angry?
Tell me about a time you had to go above and beyond to get the job done.
Is there anything else you would like me to know about you?
What  questions do you have for me?

title: Operations Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Waterford.org (Cedar City, UT) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Fairly standard interview process with a couple of steps missing from a typical for-profit business but that's unsurprising. The people were super friendly and responsive to questions. Overall, very stress free interview process.
Interview Questions: The questions were typical; essentially asking why we should hire you, though there was a portion that delved into personal thoughts/feelings/etc.

title: Product Owner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Waterford.org (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions:
A recruiter from Waterford reached out to me on LinkedIn and then I filled out the online application. 

I had a video screening (5/21) , an interview with the VP of Product (5/26) and then a 3 person panel interview (6/8). All of them went well and I was invited to submit 4 references as the final phase of the process. Then I was ghosted, didn't hear back from them at all. The last communication I received was over 1.5 months ago.

Even if I wasn't getting an offer, some feedback or even basic correspondence that I didn't get the job would have been nice.
Interview Questions: Standard PM questions, Scrum/Agile questions etc. Nothing too crazy but it does make you think about your answers.

title: Product Owner Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Waterford.org in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was extremely smooth, well communicated, and a great opportunity to learn about the role.  The initial discussion with the Internal Recruiter was helpful and thorough.  I learned a lot about the company. The following meeting was with the hiring manager where we discussed job expectations and the role in general.  The third interview was with members of the team.  All three sessions were very informative and cordial.  All were conversation oriented.
Interview Questions:
What were the most difficult aspects of your current role?  
How do you deal with conflicting priorities and initiatives.

title: Product Owner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Waterford.org (North Charleston, SC) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Overall it was a good experience. The HR team was very communicative throughout the process, and Myranda provided a great roadmap for what the interview process would entail. I feel like everyone in the organization that I met with throughout the interview stages was courteous, professional, and gave really good vibes altogether. To put simply, I felt like I was able to quickly tell that the organization had good people and culture before ever joining Waterford.
Interview Questions: Describe your thought process when planning and communicating requirement for a new feature within the software. I can't remember the exact scenario, but they gave an example feature and wanted to talk through how I would begin the software development lifecycle.

title: Partnership Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Waterford.org in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really thoughtful, clear expectations and next steps, and the questions were asked to know more about my qualifications and if I was a good fit for the role.
Interview Questions: What is your education background and why you chose it.

title: Bilingual Program Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Waterford.org in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Start with a human resources phone screening, then met with two program managers and interview in both Spanish and English, provide at least four references at least two being supervisors
Interview Questions: What is something on your resume you would like to highlight?

title: Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Waterford.org in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: After applying, I received a call about setting up an interview. After the time was confirmed, I received a phonecall. We discussed the company, benefits and position and responsibilities. Also discussed the salary and availability for starting.
Interview Questions: How many years of experience with said technologies?

title: Software QA Tester Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Waterford.org
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with three people- two team managers and one HR manager. Asked normal interview questions (strengths/weaknesses, how to handle stress) and required a written test to prove English proficiency. Needed to explain how to change a lightbulb, step-by-step.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Waterford.org in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, I was contacted after about one week to be interviewed by HR and then I was interviewed by a Vice President. The interview with HR was approximately 30 minutes and the VP about an hour. Both were very friendly, professional and direct in their questions and explanations.
Interview Questions: What is interesting for you about the organization? About this role specifically?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Waterford.org
Interview Descriptions: I emailed my application to HR. A VP interviewed me and then gave me a technical assessment. After turning in the assessment, I never heard back either way. It was very unprofessional to not at least give an affirmation that the assessment was received, not to mention giving notice that they moved forward with other candidates.
Interview Questions: How I would design a study to test new curriculum. Basically looking for things like validity threats.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Waterford.org in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied and after a few days was sent an assessment to complete. The assessment took a couple hours to complete and included developing a program charter, identifying and outlining roles, and constructing an initial work breakdown and success criteria. After turning it in, I heard from their recruiter within 48. We had a 30 minute call and at the end I was told that the hiring manager was out for the week, but that I would hear from them the following week to schedule an interview with her. I never heard from them again.
Interview Questions: Nothing unique - about project management experience, why I wanted to work there, etc

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Waterford.org (Taylorsville, UT) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed first with the team that works directly with summer interns, then later on with the events manager. They asked questions and had me give a presentation to assess my public speaking skills.
Interview Questions: How confident are you in your abilities to learn new computer systems?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Waterford.org
Interview Descriptions: Great interview! Enjoyed speaking to the employees. We discussed my previous work experience and how that would transfer into this role. Only downfall was I was never contacted back after the conversation.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with utilizing data in a classroom?

title: Team Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Waterford.org (Taylorsville, UT) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: They called and set up a time for the interview.  I meet with two people from the company and they asked questions.  They asked some personality based questions as well as technical questions for the job.
Interview Questions: What is your type of leadership?

title: Product Owner Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Waterford.org (Sandy, UT)
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen then in person interview. The in person interview consisted of the manager and a co-worker. The interview consisted of question addressing product management experience from work history. Good to have some questions to ask the manager and co-worker.
Interview Questions: Don't recall the most difficult question. Felt like this was too easy.

title: Product Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Waterford.org
Interview Descriptions: It took a while between my resume submission and when I got the interview. I had a phone interview and then an on site interview. The questions weren't too hard. the interview included an hr person and my potential supervisor. Very professional interview.
Interview Questions: How would you prioritize?

title: User Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Waterford.org (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and the interview process is actually quite easy.  You submit an application and then you might do either a phone or in person interview - sometimes both.  The interview was actually one of the easiest I had gone to.
Interview Questions: The what would you do if questions

title: Software Test Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Waterford.org in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions:
The position was for  Software Test Engineer .i was asked to write test cases  after which i had to give 2 technical interview rounds and one  HR round . i flunked in the  HR round . I would liek to know Questions and answers   that are asked  by HR  people to  Software Test Engineers .so i have better luck next time .
Thanx for going through and providing info .Thanx in advance .CHeers
Interview Questions: to many  questions were asked , so cant pinpoint on one particular

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Waterford.org (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jul 2008
Interview Descriptions: Cursory, keyword screening by HR. Personal interview with direct manager. No exam.
Interview Questions: Nothing unusual, just discussion of past experience with questions to identify experience and knowledge level of specific topics and skills they are seeking.
